sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of crime occurring in a neighborhood
message_1: In a certain neighborhood, the probability of a robbery occurring on any given day is 0.05. What is the probability that there will be no robbery in this neighborhood in 30 consecutive days?
message_2:
To find the probability of no robbery occurring in the neighborhood in 30 consecutive days, we need to find the probability of the complementary event (no robbery) happening each day and then multiply those probabilities together for all 30 days.

The probability of no robbery occurring on any given day is 1 - 0.05 = 0.95.
